Others: <ref> Can manage any machine with Python 2.4 or later and sshd. Control machine can be any non-Windows machine with Python 2.6 or 2.7 installed. This includes Red Hat  Debian  CentOS  OS X  any of the BSDs  and so on.</ref>

AIX: <ref>Encap  RPM  and POSIX file support only</ref>
Linux: <ref>Debian  Ubuntu; Gentoo; RPM-based distributions (CentOS  Mandrake  Red Hat  RHEL  SLES  SuSE)</ref>
OS X: <ref>POSIX File  Launchd  and MacPorts Support only</ref>

Linux: <ref>"Recent versions run on Fedora Core (3  5  6). Various people have ported some of the LCFG core to other Linux distributions  such as Debian  but these ports have not been incorporated"</ref>
OS X: <ref>"There has been an experimental port to OS X  which does work and includes some Mac-specific components. However  this is not production quality and the lack of uniform packaging system under OS X means that automatic management of installed software is likely to be difficult."</ref>
Solaris: <ref>"LCFG core has been ported back to Solaris and we are using this in production  although the software has not been packaged for distribution  and is not so well supported"</ref>

*BSD: <ref name="ReferenceA">Multiple users have successfully built and run the agent on FreeBSD  but no official package is available currently</ref>

AIX: <ref name="JavaUntested">Written in Java  so should in theory work on this platform if there is the appropriate JVM version available for it; however it has not been tested on the platform  which should be considered unsupported.</ref>

HP-UX: <ref name="Python Untested">Will run anywhere Python runs  but handlers for different platforms are untested.</ref>
Solaris: <ref>Salt was added to the OpenCSW package repository in September of 2012 in version 0.10.2 of Salt</ref>

Others: <ref>Synctool runs on any platform that supports SSH  Rsync and Python.</ref>
